'''''Epic''''' (stylized as '''''epic''''') is a 2013 American [[3D film|3D]] [[computer animation|computer-animated]] [[action film|action]]-[[adventure film|adventure]] film<ref name=THR5Animators>{{cite news|last1=Kilday|first1=Gregg|last2=Giardina|first2=Carolyn|title=Roundtable: 5 Top Animators on the Good and Bad of Celebrity Voices and Creative Input From Their Own Kids|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/frozen-despicable-me-2-animators-667766|accessdate=January 3, 2014|newspaper=The Hollywood Reporter|date=January 3, 2014}}</ref> loosely based on [[William Joyce (writer)|William Joyce]]'s children's book ''The Leaf Men and the Brave Good Bugs''.<ref name="Variety1">{{cite news |last=Fleming |first=Michael |title=Wedge turns over new 'Leaf' at Fox |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118009092 |accessdate=May 31, 2012 |newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=August 23, 2009}}</ref> It was produced by [[Blue Sky Studios]], written by William Joyce, [[James V. Hart]], Daniel Shere, Tom J. Astle and Matt Ember and directed by [[Chris Wedge]], the director of ''[[Ice Age (2002 film)|Ice Age]]'' (2002) and ''[[Robots (2005 film)|Robots]]'' (2005). The film stars the voices of [[Colin Farrell]], [[Josh Hutcherson]], [[Amanda Seyfried]], [[Christoph Waltz]], [[Aziz Ansari]], [[Chris O'Dowd]], [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]], [[Jason Sudeikis]], [[Steven Tyler]], and [[Beyoncé|Beyoncé Knowles]]. The film was released on May 24, 2013, by [[20th Century Fox]]. ''Epic'' received mixed reviews from critics and earned $268 million on a $93 million budget.
==Plot== 17 year old Mary Katherine, or M.K., moves in with her eccentric [[scientist]] father Professor Bomba, who has been searching for tiny humanoid soldiers called Leafmen. They protect the forest that Bomba lives near from wicked creatures called Boggans and their malevolent leader Mandrake. An independent young soldier named Nod decides to quit, much to the ire of the no-nonsense Leafmen leader Ronin.
The queen of the forest, Queen Tara, must choose an heir to her throne and goes out to a field of leaf pods, guarded by a laid-back [[slug]] named Mub and a wannabe Leafman [[snail]] named Grub. Immediately after she chooses a pod, the Boggans attack. Tara flees the area with the pod, and though her bodyguards do their best to protect her, they are soon overwhelmed by the sheer number of Boggans. Eventually, Ronin arrives for her and the pair fly off on his [[hummingbird]] mount. They are then attacked by Mandrake and his son Dagda. Dagda is killed by Ronin, but the former shoots Tara beforehand.
Meanwhile, M.K. decides to leave after having an argument with Bomba about his research. Before she can leave, Bomba's dog Ozzy runs into the woods. While looking for Ozzy, M.K. sees Tara falling. Dying, Tara gives her the pod and uses her magic to shrink her. She tells M.K. to take the pod to a [[Glowworm]] named Nim Galuu before she dies, and M.K. joins Ronin and the Leafmen, along with Mub and Grub. Ronin discovers that Nod has entered a race against other creatures and bugs on birds. Nod goes back on a deal with a tough [[American toad|toad]] named Bufo to [[Match fixing|throw the race]]. Before Bufo and his two henchmen can feed Nod to a snake, Ronin intervenes and orders them to leave. A reluctant Nod joins him, M.K., Mub, and Grub after hearing about Queen Tara's death, which Bufo overhears.
Ronin, Nod, M.K., Mub, and Grub eventually track Nim Galuu down. He then leads them down to the scroll library, where M.K. discovers Tara's brief message before shrinking her, and a message that will get her back to normal size. When Ronin leaves, Nod takes M.K. on a [[deer]] ride and they begin to fall in love. Meanwhile, Mandrake has had the Boggans bring Bufo to him, finding out the location of the pod. Mandrake goes to Nim Galuu's place to steal the pod, which, if it blooms in darkness, will help Mandrake destroy the forest. He takes the pod and kidnaps Mub and Grub. Ronin scolds Nod for not being there to protect the pod. To get into Boggan territory undiscovered, M.K., Nod, and Ronin set out to Bomba's house to get some disguises, where M.K. learns that the Leafmen have deliberately been leading Bomba off their trail. Bomba sees that he has visitors and captures M.K., fainting when he sees her. M.K. marks the location of Moonhaven on a map Bomba has made of the forest before rejoining Nod and Ronin.
When they reach the Boggan land Ronin distracts the Boggans while M.K. and Nod rescue Mub, Grub, and the pod. Mandrake discovers them and orders the Boggans to stop them. M.K., Nod, Mub, and Grub escape alive, but Ronin sacrifices himself to ensure their escape. Before the [[full moon]] can sprout the pod at Moonhaven, Mandrake's [[bat]]s block the light, causing the pod to begin sprouting in darkness. The Leafmen set out to fight the Boggans; M.K. tries to get help from her father by visiting his various cameras he had set in the forest. However, upon regaining consciousness, Bomba believes that he didn't really see M.K. and that he has been insane all these years, and shuts down all his cameras. He changes his mind when he sees the red push-pin that M.K. had put on his map.
Bomba is overjoyed to see that he has been right and he follows M.K. to Moonhaven. M.K. uses Bomba's [[iPod]] to make bat sounds, luring Mandrake's bats away. Meanwhile, Mub and Nim Galuu try to stop Mandrake from reaching the pod, but are unsuccessful. Just then, Ronin appears, bearing scars and bruises from the Boggans. Mandrake manages to outdo him, but is defended by Nod, who finally realizes the importance of teamwork. Before Mandrake can obtain his victory, the pod blooms in moonlight, defeating the Boggans, and sealing Mandrake into the burl of a nearby tree.
The chosen heir is the flower child who helped save Tara earlier in the film. Grub becomes a Leafman, Nod and Ronin reconcile, and Nod and M.K. kiss before M.K. is returned to her original size. After reuniting with Bomba and becoming his assistant, the human family still keeps regular contact with their small friends as they continue the research of their world.

as Queen Tara, the [[Mother Nature]]-like queen of the forest and Ronin's childhood love.<ref name="Deadline1" /> * [[Blake Anderson]] as Dagda, Mandrake's son and the Boggan general.<ref name="Philstar">{{cite news|title=Blue Sky Studios breaks new grounds in the animated spectacle 'Epic (3D)'|url=http://www.philstar.com/movies/2013/04/15/930940/blue-sky-studios-breaks-new-grounds-animated-spectacle-epic-3d|accessdate=April 26, 2013|newspaper=Philstar|date=April 15, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Business">{{cite press release |author=Twentieth Century Fox| title=Twentieth Century Fox Animation and Blue Sky Studios Announce EPIC Casting |url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20120531006525/en/Twentieth-Century-Fox-Animation-Blue-Sky-Studios |accessdate=May 31, 2012 |publisher=Business Wire |date=May 31, 2012}}</ref> *[[Judah Friedlander]] as Larry, a taxi driver. *[[Thomas F. Wilson]] as Finn, second-in-command of the Leafmen. His name only appears in the closing credits. *[[John DiMaggio]] as Pinecone Jinn. *[[Rosa Salazar]] as Roller Derby Girl. *[[Kyle Kinane]] as Biker Dude. *[[Emma Kenney]] as Marigold Girl.
==Production== In 2006, it was reported that Chris Wedge would be directing an animated feature film based on [[William Joyce (writer)|William Joyce]]'s book, ''The Leaf Men and the Brave Good Bugs'' for Fox Animation. Joyce, who had already collaborated with Wedge as a designer and producer on the 2005 film ''[[Robots (2005 film)|Robots]]'', was set to produce the film.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ball |first=Ryan |title=Fox Falls for Joyce's Leaf Men |url=http://www.animationmagazine.net/features/fox-falls-for-joyces-leaf-men |accessdate=June 4, 2012 |newspaper=Animation Magazine |date=August 23, 2006}}</ref> At one point, Wedge got permission to find a new home for the film and turned to [[Pixar]], led by [[John Lasseter]], a close friend that Wedge knew from working on ''[[Tron]]''. When Pixar tried to close the rights for the film and start development, Fox changed their mind, and the film returned to Fox. The film was officially greenlit in 2009, under the title ''Leaf Men''.<ref name="Variety1" /> In May 2012, Fox announced the final title for the film (''Epic''), its first cast details, and a plot.<ref name="Deadline1" /> According to Wedge, he was not satisfied with the renaming, which was decided by the marketing department. He also expressed dissatisfaction with subtitles given to the film in some non-English countries, including the French subtitle, ''The Battle of the Secret Kingdom''.<ref>{{cite web|title=(INTERVIEW) A PROPOS D’EPIC AVEC CHRIS WEDGE|url=http://www.focusonanimation.com/interview-propos-depic-chris-wedge-18393/|accessdate=October 8, 2013|publisher=Focus on Animation|date=October 8, 2013|author=Nbu|language=French}}</ref>
Although the film is based on and borrows many characters from Joyce's book, its plot has been significantly changed. Wedge explained: "[W]hile Bill wrote a wonderful book, it is a quaint story. We wanted to make a gigantic action-adventure movie." To address online speculations about whether the film is similar to other films, like ''[[FernGully: The Last Rainforest]]'' or ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]'', Wedge said: "I hate to associate it with other movies. It is adventure on the scale of ''[[Star Wars]]''. And it does immerse the audience completely in a world like ''Avatar''. But it has its own personality."<ref name="USATodaySneak" />
==Release== The film was released publicly on May 16, 2013, in Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Germany, Peru, Puerto Rico, and Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|author=EpicINTL Release Dates in Facebook |url=https://www.facebook.com/EpicTheMovie/app_151503908244383 |title=Epic - INTL Release Dates |publisher=Facebook |date=|accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> The film was released in the United States on May 24, 2013.<ref name="USATodaySneak" />
===Box office=== Produced on a budget of $93 million,<ref name="VarietyWeekend" /><ref name="DeadlineWeekend" /> ''Epic'' grossed $107,518,682 in North America, and $160,907,952 in other countries, for a worldwide total of $268,426,634.<ref name="mojo" /> In North America, the film earned $9.3 million on its opening day,<ref name=DeadlineWeekend /> and opened to number four in its first weekend, with $33,531,068, behind ''[[Fast & Furious 6]]'', ''[[The Hangover Part III]]'', and ''[[Star Trek Into Darkness]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2013&wknd=21&p=.htm |title=Weekend Box Office Results for May 24-26, 2013 |publisher=IMDB | work = [[Box Office Mojo]] |date=|accessdate=May 26, 2013}}</ref> In its second weekend, the film dropped to number five, grossing an additional $16,616,310.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2013&wknd=22&p=.htm |title=Weekend Box Office Results for May 31-June 2, 2013 |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date=June 2, 2013 |accessdate=January 16, 2014}}</ref> In its third weekend, the film stayed at number five, grossing $11,876,003.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2013&wknd=23&p=.htm |title=Weekend Box Office Results for June 7-9, 2013 |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date= |accessdate=January 16, 2014}}</ref> In its fourth weekend, the film dropped to number seven, grossing $6,284,905.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2013&wknd=24&p=.htm |title=Weekend Box Office Results for June 14-16, 2013 |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date= |accessdate=January 16, 2014}}</ref> While the film was overshadowed by other animated films that summer including ''[[Monsters University]]'' and ''[[Despicable Me 2]]'', the film finished in third out of six family films that summer, and became a moderate box office success.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/showdowns/chart/?id=animationsummer13.htm |title=Summer 2013 Family Movies |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date= |accessdate=September 29, 2013}}</ref>
===Critical reception=== ''Epic'' received mixed reviews from critics. [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gives the film a score of 64% based on 119 reviews, with an average rating of 5.9/10. The site's critical consensus reads: "Though its narrative themes are all too familiar, ''Epic'' is beautifully animated and crafted with just enough flair to make for solid family entertainment."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/epic_2013/ |title=Epic |publisher=[[Flixster]] | work=Rotten Tomatoes |date=August 20, 2012 |accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> Another review aggregation website, [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[Normalization (statistics)|normalized]] rating out of 100 top reviews from mainstream critics, calculated a score of 52 out of 100 based on 30 reviews.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/epic-2013 |title=Epic Reviews |publisher=CBS Interactive | work = Metacritic |date=|accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> Audiences polled by the market research firm [[CinemaScore]] gave ''Epic'' an "A" grade on average and an "A+" among kids.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-fast-6-558677|title=Box Office Report: 'Fast 6' Earns $122 Million-Plus, Runs 'Hangover III' Off Course|work=The Hollywood Reporter|last=McClintock |first=Pamela|date=May 27, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2013}}</ref>
Stephan Lee of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave the film a B+, saying "The story lacks the specialness of a [[Pixar]] movie—it retreads the same eco-battle archetypes as ''[[FernGully: The Last Rainforest|FernGully]]'' and ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]—''but it's a perfectly appealing explosion of color for a lazy summer day."<ref>{{cite web|last=Lee |first=Stephan |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20687762,00.html |title=Epic Movie Review Review |work=Entertainment Weekly |date=May 22, 2013 |accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> Michael Rechtshaffen of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' gave the film a mixed review, saying "Where the animated film comes up short is on the inspiration front—despite the intriguing terrain, its stock inhabitants lack the sort of unique personality traits that would prevent them from feeling overly familiar."<ref>{{cite news |last=Rechtshaffen |first=Michael |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/epic/review/525671 |title=Epic Review |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=May 17, 2013 |accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> Michael Phillips of the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' gave the film two stars, saying "It's difficult to keep its story and characters, or even its visual design, in your mind's eye, in part because the five credited screenwriters overload the narrative with incident and threatening complication."<ref>{{cite news|last=Phillips |first=Michael |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/movies/sc-epic-movie-review-20130523,0,1430441.column |title='Epic' can't see the forest for the plot |work=Chicago Tribune |date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref> Kyle Smith of the ''[[New York Post]]'' gave the film one-and-a-half stars out of four, saying "It’s not that the plot of ''Epic'' is complex; it’s just untidy. There’s a lot going on that goes nowhere."<ref>{{cite news|last=Smith |first=Kyle |url=https://nypost.com/2013/05/23/do-not-go-out-on-a-limb-for-epic/ |title=Do not go out on a limb for ‘Epic’ |work=New York Post |date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=May 24, 2013}}</ref> Moira Macdonald of ''[[The Seattle Times]]'' gave the film three-and-a-half stars out of four, saying "The story's simple enough to appeal to young kids (the 8-year-old with me pronounced the movie "awesome"), but adults will enjoy the beautiful animation, whether 3D or 2D."<ref>{{cite web|last=Macdonald |first=Moira |url=http://seattletimes.com/html/movies/2021037423_movieepicxml.html |title=‘Epic’: Wee warriors in a grand adventure |work=The Seattle Times |date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=May 24, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714152912/http://seattletimes.com/html/movies/2021037423_movieepicxml.html |archivedate=July 14, 2014 |df=mdy }}</ref> Stephen Holden of ''[[The New York Times]]'' gave the film two-and-a-half stars out of five, saying "As beautiful as it is, ''Epic'' is fatally lacking in visceral momentum and dramatic edge."<ref>{{cite news|last=Holden |first=Stephen |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/24/movies/epic-directed-by-chris-wedge.html?_r=0 |title=Tiny Folk in a Big War of Good Versus Evil |work=The New York Times |date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=May 24, 2013}}</ref>
===Home media=== ''Epic'' was released on DVD, Blu-ray and Blu-ray 3D on August 20, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Epic Officially Announced|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=11722|accessdate=August 23, 2013|publisher=Blu-ray.com|date=August 23, 2013}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox video game | title = Euro Truck Simulator 2 | image = Euro Truck Simulator 2 cover.jpg | developer = [[SCS Software]] | publisher = SCS Software | series = ''[[Truck Simulator]]'' | engine = [[:ru:Prism3D|Prism3d]] | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Linux]]|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[macOS]]}} | released = {{Unbulleted list|'''Microsoft Windows'''|19 October 2012|'''Linux'''|16 April 2013 {{small|(beta)}}|'''macOS'''|29 January 2015}} | genre = [[Vehicle simulation game|Vehicle simulation]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }}
'''''Euro Truck Simulator 2''''' (commonly abbreviated as '''''ETS2''''') is a [[vehicle simulation game]] developed and published by [[SCS Software]] for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[macOS]] and was initially released as open development on 19 October 2012<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2012/10/the-time-is-now.html</ref>. The game is a direct sequel to the 2008 game ''[[Euro Truck Simulator]]'' and it is the second video game in the ''[[Truck Simulator]]'' series. The player can drive one of a choice of [[Articulated vehicle|articulated]] trucks across a depiction of [[Europe]], picking up cargo from various locations and delivering it. As the game progresses, it is possible for the player to buy more vehicles, depots, and hire other drivers to work for them.
The game has sold over 5 million units on [[Steam (software)|Steam]] as of November 2018, according to the metrics website [[Steam Spy]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://steamspy.com/app/227300 |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 |last= |first= |date= |website=Steam Spy |publisher=|access-date=10 December 2016}}</ref>
== Gameplay == [[File:Euro Truck Simulator 2 driver view screenshot.jpg|thumb|right|Driver's view from a [[DAF XF]] during game play]] Players choose their HQ's location in any of the game map's cities. At first, the player can only take what are known as Quick jobs—these jobs involve making hired driver deliveries while employed by a delivery company, with a provided truck and all expenses (fuel, road tolls, ferry crossings) covered. As the player earns money or takes bank loans, they can eventually afford to buy themselves a truck, acquire a home garage, and start making more money by delivering cargo using their own truck instead of just being a driver for hire. Money earned in the game can be spent on upgrading or purchasing new trucks, hiring [[Non-player character|NPC]] drivers to take on deliveries, buying more garages and expanding the home garage to accommodate more trucks and drivers. The skills of the drivers hired by the player also grow with experience and the player can create a huge fleet of the trucks and drivers expanding the business across Europe.
As players progress and earn money, they are also to purchase their own trailers, which can be fully customized in the same way as trucks. Player-owned trailers can be used to receive and deliver cargo at existing storage locations. Like trucks, trailers can also be allocated to company employees, resulting in higher income.
The player gains experience points after each delivery. A skill point is awarded after each level-up. Skill points can be used to unlock deliveries that require different [[European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road|ADR]] classes, longer distance deliveries, special cargo loads, fragile cargo loads, deliveries that are urgent and eco-driving. This progression allows the player to take on better paid jobs.
The base game features 71 cities in twelve different countries, over twenty different types of cargo and over fifteen fictional European companies. There are four map DLCs that expand the game to more countries and locations, and multiple other truck and trailer DLCs.
The game also features a "Radio" feature, which allows players to play MP3 and [[Ogg|OGG]] files. It also allows the player to listen to [[Internet radio]].
The game includes two new truck companies, [[Scania AB|Scania]] and [[Renault Trucks|Renault]], with [[MAN SE|MAN]] returning from the [[German Truck Simulator|original game]]. [[DAF Trucks|DAF]], [[Iveco]], [[Mercedes-Benz]] and [[Volvo Trucks|Volvo]] trucks were not officially licensed and had their names changed to DAV, Ivedo, Majestic and Valiant respectively. Later updates included the official branding for the [[DAF XF]],<ref name="DAF">{{cite web |title=DAF Trucks coming to Euro Truck Simulator 2! |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2012/10/daf-trucks-coming-to-euro-truck.html |work=SCS Software's Blog |publisher=SCS Software |accessdate=25 January 2013 |date=27 October 2012}}</ref> [[Volvo FH]], [[Iveco Stralis]]<ref name="Volvo">{{cite web |title=A New ETS2 Patch Almost Here |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/01/a-new-ets2-patch-almost-here.html |work=SCS Software's Blog |publisher=SCS Software |accessdate=25 January 2013 |date=25 January 2013}}</ref> and [[Mercedes-Benz Actros]].
== Development == Initially released for Windows and available for purchase & download via SCS's own website, the game would eventually be added to [[Steam (software)|Steam]] in January 2013<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/01/steam-tomorrow.html</ref>. Expanding beyond the Windows version, SCS announced in March 2013 that they were developing a Mac version of the game.<ref>{{cite web |author=SCS Software |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/03/scania-tds-on-mac-app-store.html |title=SCS Software's blog: Scania TDS on Mac App Store |publisher=blog.scssoft.com |date=18 March 2013 |accessdate=9 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 for the Mac |url=http://www.paulthetall.com/index_files/f95563f7cb8bd757bbec493268b18f15-1389.html |publisher=PaultheTall.com |accessdate=7 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130908172255/http://www.paulthetall.com/index_files/f95563f7cb8bd757bbec493268b18f15-1389.html |archivedate=8 September 2013}}</ref> One month later they released a Linux beta version of the game to the public through [[Steam (software)|Steam]].<ref name="linux-beta-release">{{cite web |title=Public Linux Beta of Euro Truck Simulator 2 |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/04/public-linux-beta-of-euro-truck.html |work=SCS Software's Blog |publisher=SCS Software |accessdate=29 April 2013 |date=16 April 2013}}</ref> On 27 February, they stated "the Mac OS port of ETS2 is taking longer than anybody would like, but trust us, we are still working hard on it."<ref>{{cite web |author=SCS Software |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2014/02/bus-driver-pocket-edition.html |title=SCS Software's blog: Bus Driver - Pocket Edition |publisher=blog.scssoft.com |date=27 February 2014 |accessdate=6 April 2014}}</ref> Finally, on 19 December 2014, they announced on their blog that the [[OS X]] version of the game is ready for a public beta available on [[Steam (software)|Steam]].<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2014/12/euro-truck-simulator-2-now-available-as.html</ref> On 21 January 2015 a 64-bit version of Euro Truck Simulator 2 was released, which allows for more memory to be used by the game.
In July 2013 a large update was released, fixing various graphical glitches, improving the toll booths and included the ability to switch off the trucks' speed limiter from within the gameplay options.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/2013/07/25/euro-truck-simulator-2-receives-a-truckload-of-fixes/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 receives a truckload of fixes |publisher=Future Publishing Limited |website=PC Gamer |first=Perry |last=Vandell |date=25 July 2013 |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref>
In October 2013, SCS announced support for the [[Oculus Rift]] [[virtual reality headset]] which became available in the beta 1.9 update released in March 2014.<ref>{{cite web |last=Cavalli |first=Earnest |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2013/10/24/euro-truck-simulator-2-shifts-gears-to-add-oculus-rift-support/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 shifts gears to add Oculus Rift support |publisher=AOL Inc. |website=Joystiq |date=24 October 2013 |accessdate=28 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Duda |first=Tomáš |title=ETS2 update 1.9 is live! |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2014/03/ets2-update-19-is-live.html |work=SCS Software Blog |publisher=SCS Software |accessdate=29 March 2014}}</ref>
In May 2014, ''ETS 2'' was updated out of beta with patch 1.10.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://steamcommunity.com/games/227300/announcements/detail/1281583999477922962 |title=ETS2 update 1.10. Get your free copy of Metallic Paint Jobs DLC! |accessdate=21 May 2014 |author=TIMMY |date=19 May 2014}}</ref> In July 2014, ''ETS 2'' released an open beta of patch 1.11 on Steam. The full patch contains 3 new cities in Austria and Italy, along with an improved layout and UI, a way to adjust your seating in the cabin, and a feature that allows you to sell/trade your garages. In January 2015, ''ETS 2'' was updated with support for 64 bit, and officially released for [[OS X]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2015/01/euro-truck-simulator-2-now-officially.html |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 now officially on Mac OS X! |publisher=''SCS Software'' |accessdate=29 April 2016 |author=Cyanide_snubben |date=25 January 2015}}</ref> On 8 September 2015, SCS Blog announced the completion of 5 years of their blog as well as the upcoming feature in v1.21 (Cabin Accessories DLC).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2015/09/five-years-and-counting.html |title=Five Years and Counting |publisher=''SCS Software'' |accessdate=29 April 2016 |author=Cyanide_snubben |date=8 September 2015}}</ref>
== Downloadable content ==
===Expansion packs=== Euro Truck Simulator 2 offers several [[Downloadable content|DLC]] base map [[expansion packs]]. Below is a list of major expansion packs provided by the developers.
{| class="wikitable" style="width: 100%;" !style="width: 15%;height:50px;"|Name !style="width: 15%;"|Release date !Description |- |'''''Going East''''' |20 September 2013 |In January 2013 SCS Software announced a [[downloadable content]] (DLC) package — ''Going East!'', expanding the game map into [[Eastern Europe]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/01/ets2-eastern-european-expansion.html |title=ETS2 Eastern European Expansion |publisher=SCS Software |website=SCS Software |date=31 January 2013 |accessdate=13 August 2013}}</ref> The DLC saw the introduction of thirteen new cities across [[Poland]], [[Slovakia]], the [[Czech Republic]] and [[Hungary]] and was released in 20 September 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/2013/09/04/euro-truck-simulator-2-heads-east-for-its-first-dlc-expansion/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 heads east for its first DLC expansion |publisher=Future Publishing Limited |website=PC Gamer |first=Phil |last=Savage |date=4 September 2013 |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref> In July 2015 (version 1.19), Hungary gained 2 more cities: [[Pécs]] and [[Szeged]] along with some roads in [[Austria]] and Hungary.<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2015/07/euro-truck-simulator-2-update-119-is.html</ref> |- |'''''Scandinavia''''' |7 May 2015 |On 7 May 2015 SCS released a second DLC similar to ''Going East!'', called ''Scandinavia''. It features a map extension to Scandinavia and features [[Denmark]], [[Norway]], and [[Sweden]]. The DLC also contains 2 new types of trailers: a livestock trailer and a trailer for transporting trucks. The latter can be picked up at the [[Volvo Trucks]] and [[Scania AB|Scania]] factories in Sweden, which have been recreated in the game. |- |'''''Vive la France!''''' |5 December 2016 |In 2016, SCS Software officially announced a new DLC named ''Vive la France !''. It adds 15 new cities from [[France]], 20,000 km of new roads, famous landmarks, enhanced vegetation, new cargoes to haul, new industries and new companies. It was released on 5 December 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://scssoft.com/press/sheet.php?p=euro_truck_simulator_2_vive_la_france |title=SCS Software {{!}} Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Vive la France!|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=[[SCS Software]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161211130251/http://scssoft.com/press/sheet.php?p=euro_truck_simulator_2_vive_la_france|archive-date=12 November 2016|access-date=12 November 2016}}</ref> |- |'''''Italia''''' |5 December 2017 |On 11 August 2017, SCS announced the ''Italia'' DLC,<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2017/08/bella-italia.html</ref> which was released on 5th December 2017. It expanded the game into mainland [[Italy]] and [[Sicily]], and the northern Italian cities included in the base game received an upgrade. |- |'''''Beyond The Baltic Sea''''' |29 November 2018<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2018/11/beyond-baltic-sea-releasing-on-november.html |title=Beyond the Baltic Sea releasing on November 29}}</ref> |The ''Beyond the Baltic Sea'' DLC was announced by SCS Software on 2 March 2018,<ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2018/03/beyond-baltic-sea.html</ref> consisting countries within the [[Baltic states|Baltics]] including portions of [[Finland]] and [[Russia]] (along with [[Kaliningrad Oblast]]). The pack includes [[Border checkpoint|border checkpoints]] in Russia. It was released on 29 November 2018. |- |}
=== ''Paint Jobs'' === A set of [[Halloween]]-themed paint jobs was released exclusively on Valve's [[Steam (software)|Steam]] store on 24 October 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/258460/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Halloween Paint Jobs Pack on Steam |publisher=Store.steampowered.com |date= |accessdate=26 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/10/euro-truck-simulator-2-version-17-update.html |title=Halloween paint job blog posting on SCS Software Blog |publisher=SCS Software |website=SCS Software Blog |date=24 October 2013 |accessdate=5 January 2014}}</ref> On 10 December 2013, a set of [[winter]] themed paint jobs<ref>{{cite web |url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/266930/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Ice Cold Paint Jobs Pack on Steam |publisher=Store.steampowered.com |date= |accessdate=5 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2013/12/ice-cold-paint-jobs-dlc-available-now.html |title=Ice Cold paint job blog posting on SCS Software Blog |publisher=SCS Software |website=SCS Software Blog |date=10 December 2013 |accessdate=5 January 2014}}</ref> called ''Ice Cold'' were released. These themes can be applied to any truck in the game. On 4 April 2014, SCS Software released six more paint jobs in a DLC pack called "Force of Nature" and all paint jobs are still Steam DLC only. The ''Going East!'' DLC however, is both Steam and Non-Steam DLC. Finally, in the 1.10/1.11 update there are 5 new paint schemes with the UK flag, the Irish flag, the Scottish flag, the American flag and the Canadian flag. On 3 October 2014, [[SCS Software]] released some colorschemes based on the [[Flag of Germany|German flag]], prior to the 24th anniversary of the reunion of Germany. During December 2014 and January 2015 on World of Trucks only, there was an exclusive paint skin that many players still have y called the Ravens Paint Pack. It included only two Raven style paints (1 blue, 1 gold), and was only unlocked if you delivered Christmas trailers the approximate distance from Praha, Czech Republic to the Geographic North Pole which in the end came down to 2,760 miles (4,443 km). The Ravens Paint Pack DLC was originally not available for purchase; however on 6 March 2017 SCS Software released it as a paid-DLC, with some additional content, through Steam for US$1.99.<ref>http://store.steampowered.com/app/318521/Euro_Truck_Simulator_2__Raven_Truck_Design_Pack/</ref><ref>http://blog.scssoft.com/2017/03/raven-truck-design-pack.html</ref>
=== ''High Power Cargo Pack'' === ''High Power Cargo Pack'' DLC expands the cargo range in the game by adding custom cargoes. The new cargoes are usually large, long and heavy and include a [[helicopter]], various tractors and drillers, air conditioners and even a yacht. An extra bonus included with the pack is a special Heavy Duty customizable paint job.
=== ''Schwarzmüller Trailer Pack'' === On 16 September 2016 SCS released the first officially licensed trailer pack for the game. The ''Schwarzmüller Trailer Pack'' add five new and original modeled [[Semi-Trailer]]s of the [[Austria]]n-based semi-trailer conductor {{Interlanguage link multi|Schwarzmüller|de|3=Schwarzmüller (Unternehmen)}} into the game.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.scssoft.com/2016/09/schwarzmuller-trailer-pack-dlc.html |title=Schwarzmueller Trailer pack announcement blog posting on SCS Software Blog |publisher=SCS Software |website=SCS Software Blog |date=16 September 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref>
=== ''Cabin Accessories'' === The ''Cabin Accessories'' DLC adds various items to customize the cabin of your truck, such as banners, pennants, bobbleheads, a portable navigator and even fuzzy dice which will respond to the cabin's movements. It was released on 30 September 2015.<ref name=":0">http://blog.scssoft.com/2015/09/cabin-accessories-dlc-available-now.html</ref>
=== Steam Workshop integration === In the 1.23 beta, SCS Software integrated [[Valve Corporation|Valve]]'s [[Steam Workshop]] into the game, allowing mod authors to upload their creations onto the Euro Truck Simulator 2 Steam Workshop page. This lets players subscribe to a mod and Steam will download and install it to their game. These mods range from trailers and companies to new trucks and sound packs. Mod authors use a tool named SCS Workshop Uploader to get their mods published on the ''Workshop Page''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/227300/announcements/detail/747967771614054841 |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Open Beta 1.23 is out - Steam Workshop, wheel customization |publisher=steamcommunity.com |date= |accessdate=25 March 2016}}</ref>
=== ''Heavy Cargo Pack'' === On 12 May 2017, SCS released the ''Heavy Cargo Pack'' DLC which added eight new cargo types. Each cargo is large and very heavy in weight, and is transported on a special trailer with steerable rear axles.
=== ''Special Transport'' === The Special Transport DLC was released on 13 December 2017, consisting of [[Oversize load|even heavier cargoes]] that exceed regular cargo regulations, with [[Escort vehicle|escort vehicles]] that will help guide the player deliver cargo at short distances. Unlike regular and heavy cargoes, the player cannot make stops at rest areas, gas stations or deviate away from escort vehicles.
=== ''Krone Trailer Pack'' === Released on 18 September 2018, the ''Krone Trailer Pack'' is the second licensed trailer pack to be added (only after the Schwarzmüller Trailer Pack)<ref>blog.scssoft.com/2018/09/krone-trailer-pack.html</ref>, the DLC currently adds 6 new trailers and various accessories.
== Reception == {{Video game reviews | MC = 79/100<ref name="MC"/> | Destruct = 8.5/10<ref name="Destructoid"/> | PCGUS = 85/100<ref name="PC Gamer"/> }}
The game was generally well received by critics, holding a score of 79/100 on [[Metacritic]], indicating "generally favorable reviews".<ref name="MC">{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/euro-truck-simulator-2 |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 for PC Reviews |publisher=CBS Interactive |website=Metacritic |date=18 January 2013 |accessdate=18 July 2013}}</ref>
In a review for ''[[Destructoid]]'', Jim Sterling praised the game's accessibility, noting how easy the GPS and map features were to use, as well as the option to stream European internet radio, and the multitude of control options available. He also praised the graphics, stating that "[f]rom the shape of the traffic lights to the atmosphere of the backdrops, there's a sense of individuality to each new territory you uncover, and the trucks themselves are lovingly recreated with an intricate level of detail", although he did criticise the [[Artificial intelligence (video games)|AI]] of the other vehicles on the road.<ref name="Destructoid">{{cite web |url=http://www.destructoid.com/review-euro-truck-simulator-2-243592.phtml |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 |website=Destructoid |first=Jim |last=Sterling |date=31 January 2013 |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref> In a similarly favourable review, Tim Stone of ''[[PC Gamer]]'' called it "unexpectedly engrossing", praising the size of the map and the variation of the roads and scenery available. He did however have reservations about the accuracy of the surroundings, commenting "no one seems to have told SCS’s countryside crafters that rural Britain features long green things called hedges. Cities are often depicted with the shortest of visual shorthand – a few warehouses, the odd landmark if you’re lucky."<ref name="PC Gamer">{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/review/euro-truck-simulator-2-review/ |title=Euro Truck Simulator 2 review |publisher=Future Publishing Limited |website=PC Gamer |first=Tim |last=Stone |date=6 December 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref>
=== Awards === ''PC Gamer'' awarded the game "Sim of the Year 2012" in its end-of-year awards.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/2012/12/27/the-sim-of-the-year-2012-euro-truck-simulator-2/ |title=The Sim of the Year 2012: Euro Truck Simulator 2 |publisher=Future Publishing Limited |website=PC Gamer |first=Tim |last=Stone |date=27 December 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref> ''[[Rock, Paper, Shotgun]]'' listed ''Euro Truck Simulator 2'' ninth on their list of "The 25 Best Simulation Games Ever Made".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2015/05/15/best-simulation-games/5/ |title=The 25 Best Simulation Games Ever Made |publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun |accessdate=12 September 2016}}</ref>
Users of the Steam distribution platform voted Euro Truck Simulator 2 to win "I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award" and the "Sit Back and Relax"-award in [[Steam Awards]] 2016.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Winners |url=http://store.steampowered.com/SteamAwards/ |website=steampowered.com |publisher=Steam |accessdate=1 January 2017}}</ref>
